page.title: 02The A2 - Blessing or Burden?
page.content: The A2 (known locally as the motorway) runs from Dover to London and is built over the first ever Roman road-Watling Street.Traffic reaches its peak during the early morning and evening rush hours but,by mid-morning vehicles are still passing at the rate of one per second.A survey carried out by pupils at Painters Ash CP School,which lies next to the road,revealed that local residents found it convenient to live close to the road as it offers easy access to London and the Kent coast. But living so near does have its drawbacks.A majority had found it necessary to fit double-glazing to keep out traffic noise.There was much concern about possible health risks from breathing in poisonous traffic fumes and many felt that lead-free petrol should be introduced.However, most people wished to stay.
